channel.title: Mobile Video on 0x000216
channel.description: Recent content in Mobile Video on 0x000216

item.title: Samsung Intercept Android Phone Goes NASCAR
item.description: What’s both thrilling and fast-paced, almost too much to handle? NASCAR is a fitting example, but so is the Samsung Intercept Android phone. And surprisingly, they’re connected! The Samsung Intercept M910 for Sprint is a dual phone, offering both a large 3-inch touchscreen display and a slide-out QWERTY keyboard with spacious keys for efficient typing and texting. As an Android 2.1 phone, it offers access to thousands of customizable apps from the Android market.

item.title: 4G Wireless Broadband Wars This Year
item.description: The race for 4G dominance is about to start, even though 3G deployment is still underway. Major carriers like AT&T, Verizon, and Sprint have upgraded most of their towers in populated areas, and 3G devices are readily available. However, the focus is shifting to 4G due to the increasing demand for bandwidth from sophisticated mobile applications and the ongoing competition among carriers. The value of 4G lies in its potential to enable future advancements rather than just meeting current needs.

item.title: iPhone Getting its Video in a Sling
item.description: The mobile video landscape is seeing growth in various forms, including carrier-specific services like Verizon’s VCAST and Sprint TV, and dedicated channels such as MediaFLO. Sling Media’s introduction of a SlingPlayer for iPhone has the potential to disrupt the market by giving control of content back to the user. Sling Media is known for its Slingbox, a device that connects to your television source (satellite receiver, DVR, or cable box) and a broadband connection.
